Speaker: ﻿Narrator
Text: Since the dawn of time, the armies of Heaven and Hell have waged an endless war. Drawn to the conflict was the Charred Council, an entity bound by ancient laws to preserve order and balance. It held that any great power, unchecked, threatened the very fabric of the universe. In time, Heaven and Hell came to honor the Council and its laws, for none were beyond the swift and terrible justice of the Council’s enforcers-- a fearsome brotherhood known as the Four Horsemen. Amid the turmoil, the first humans emerged. The Council foretold that these weak, but cunning creatures would someday be integral to the Balance. Thus, a third kingdom was named the Kingdom of Man. By order of the Council, a truce was forged between Heaven and Hell. The great pact was bound by Seven Seals, to be broken at the appointed time-- when Man’s Kingdom stood ready for the Endwar-- a battle that would bring balance, and determine the ultimate fate of the three kingdoms…
[The apocalypse has begun. War falls from the sky and begint to stretch his arms at the first enemies, recalling the basics.]

Speaker: Angel
Text: WAR is here! Judgment approaches!
[Suddenly, War loses his massive demonic form.]

Speaker: War
Text: What… is happening?
[Nevertheless, he continues to fight.]

Speaker: Angel
Text: We will not yield! Your justice is at hand.
[War sees several elite angels fighting demons.]

Speaker: War
Text: Impossible... Abaddon... What is this? Where are my brothers?

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: This cannot be. The final Seal...
[He’s being attacked by a demon.]

Speaker: Woman Angel
Text: My Lord!

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: ...how... did this happen...?
[He succeeds in defeating a demon. War is getting worse.]

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: The Seventh Seal was not broken!!!
[He’s grabbed the giant stone hand of another demon.]

Speaker: Woman Angel
Text: Abaddon!  What in Heaven’s name have you done?

Speaker: War
Text: I answer the call.
[The giant demon that killed Abbadon is attacking War. War takes on a fight and loses. The demon laughs and throws him away.]

Speaker: War
Text: The Law... has been broken...

Speaker: Demon
Text: And so have you, Horseman.
[He grabs it and squeezes it in his fist, breaking all the bones. War is now stands before three Judges.]

Speaker: Judge 2
Text: The Law is clear: When the Seventh Seal is broken... Four Horseman shall ride forth co punish the wicked. Four Horsemen shall ride forth to punish the wicked... be they Sons of Men... Lords of Heaven... or the Dregs of Hell... All upon the Earth will be judged, and the pact forged anew... YOU FORGET YOUR POST, HORSEMAN! YOU FORGET THE LAW!! No call was given! Yet the Destroyer marched, and there you were found -- under his black banner if the claims are true.

Speaker: War
Text: To hell with your claims! The Seals were broken! I was summoned!

Speaker: Judge 1
Text: But where are the other Horsemen? Were they not “summoned” as well?

Speaker: Judge 3
Text: The Seven Seals are hidden, as they have been since the pact was forged, eons ago... all of them intact... there was no call. You aided the Dark Ones. Broke a sacred covenant that has doomed Mankind, and threatened the Balance! Do you deny it?

Speaker: War
Text: When I rode... Heaven and Hell were already at war. Abaddon was there. He KNEW something...!

Speaker: Judge 2
Text: Abaddon fell, fighting off the chaos you unleashed!

Speaker: War
Text: I fought, powerless against the demons! And still you accuse me?!

Speaker: Judge 3
Text: Your defeat proves nothing! Likely, the Destroyer cast you aside when he was finished with you!

Speaker: Judge 1
Text: You have defiled the Law, Horseman. You will be punished.

Speaker: War
Text: I serve only the Council. Only the balance. As the Horsemen always have. Send me back. I will punish the ones responsible.

Speaker: Judge 3
Text: How? What hope do you have against the Destroyer’s armies? You are powerless!

Speaker: War
Text: Then I will fail, and the demons will have carried out your sentence.

Speaker: Judge 2
Text: Very well. You will return to the Earth. But, you will be watched. Come forth.
[War pushes a hand in a latent glove into lava and burns the seal on it.]

Speaker: Judge 2
Text: The Watcher is bound to you. It will ensure your loyalty.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Remember that. Or I will really get under your skin!
[The Watcher brings untold suffering to War, forcing him to fall to his knees before the Council.]

Speaker: Judge 2
Text: ENOUGH! Rise, War... and arm yourself.
[The Council gives War a sword.]

Speaker: Judge 2
Text: Chaoseater. The angry blade thirsts for destruction.
[War accepts it humbly.]

Speaker: Judge 1
Text: The souls of the dead will be your currency. Some enemies are more easily bought than killed.
[The Council transmits a large number of souls to War.]

Speaker: Judge 3
Text: Seek the demon Vulgrim. Few can afford his services, but perhaps you can strike a bargain.

Speaker: War
Text: The Council confers with demons now, does it?

Speaker: Judge 1
Text: Since the truce was broken, some demons have fallen from the Destroyer’s favor. Vulgrim is one such outcast... he has long sought an audience with us.

Speaker: War
Text: How long have I been here?
[The Watcher stifles War with pain again and they are teleporting to the human world. Devastation, jagged hellstructures and fire everywhere.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Looks like our trajectory was a little off.
[War takes his sword out of the ground and decides to leave.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Not so fast, Horseman.
[War is bent in pain.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Let’s lay down a few ground rules. Until this is over, you’re a dog on a leash. I say bark, you bark. And if I have to kick you, you’d better not bare your teeth. Understand? Or should I teach you to play dead? Good boy.
[The wrecked parking they landed in appears to be full of zombies.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Here comes the welcome party. War, why don’t you introduce yourself?
[War destroys the enemies and they enter a vast square called The Crossroads.]

Speaker: War
Text: How long was I gone?

Speaker: Watcher
Text: In Earth years? About a century. Long enough for the last of the mouth breathers to die off.

Speaker: War
Text: Then... the Third Kingdom is lost…
[He jumps into the square. A demon emerges from the ground.]

Speaker: Demon
Text: Subtle. I almost didn’t hear you coming.

Speaker: War
Text: Vulgrim.

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: The Council finally took me seriously. If so, you’re surely not empty handed.... or this shall be the briefest of introductions, not empty handed.
[War gives him the souls he received from the Council.]

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: Mmmm... there were... a few young ones... spectacular! You seek the power behind the one called “Destroyer"? You will find the answers, and the font of his power... there. Oh... such haste to die? You aren’t even a shadow of your former self.... you wouldn’t last a heartbeat. Besides, the way to the Tower is shrouded by demon magics... even I do not know the way.

Speaker: War
Text: Who does?

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: Feed my hunger... and I’ll feed your curiosity.
[War collects 500 souls for the demon.]

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: These ancient Gates have a mind of their own. But with THIS... you may reach... an understanding. Beyond the gate, seek out Samael’s Prison. Once, Samael was close in power to the Dark Prince himself. Some might even say, a threat. You will find he is no friend to the Destroyer. Seek me out when you’ve gathered more souls. I will make it worth your while...
[War gets the “Earthcaller” horn and goes to the nearby temple. He blows to the horn and wakes up the “door” of the temple.]

Speaker: Gate
Text: The Horn call of my ancestors. Awakened at last from the dreamless sleep. Then... we are free?

Speaker: War
Text: None are free while the Destroyer still breathes.

Speaker: Gate
Text: Hmmmm... The Destroyer... yes... To his service we are bound, though enemies we remain. So his enemies we call friend. Pass now, friend. Must bring victory. Must bring freedom.
[The door’s leaving.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: If that was the Gate, I can’t WAIT to find out what’s behind it!
[Walking through the territory of the temple War goes out into the street and meets a demon that looks like an orc.]

Speaker: Phantom General
Text: You have killed many of my warriors.

Speaker: War
Text: I have yet to find a warrior among you.

Speaker: Phantom General
Text: Do you know what is imprisoned here? There are things even YOU should fear, Horseman! Once you were strong. But now you are weak. And you are alone. The Destroyer knows of your coming. Even now, he moves his legions against you!

Speaker: War
Text: Then I’ll make this quick.
[Unsure of his victory, the demon calls his warriors.]

Speaker: Phantom General
Text: I will take your HEAD! To my side, dogs! Destroy this fool! I will take your HEAD! You will pay for that.
[War kills a demon by killing him with his own axe. War begins to solve the puzzle with blood and statues.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Just ONE hideous, blood puking Gargoyle? The plumbing must be stopped up...
[When War opens the portal a huge horned and winged demon comes out of it. It seems to be incredibly strong.]

Speaker: Samael
Text: War! Are you here to play executioner? They should have sent all four of you.

Speaker: War
Text: I have no interest in killing you, Samael.

Speaker: Samael
Text: Ha! The Destroyer? He’s beyond your reach. Beyond mine.

Speaker: War
Text: Has prison made you a coward?
[Samael breathes a stream of flame on him. The war hasn’t even moved.]

Speaker: Samael
Text: Perhaps there is a way... But, you will need to get inside the Destroyer’s spire. The Tower is guarded by four of his Chosen. Bring me their Hearts. And ask me no questions... My reasons for helping you are my own.

Speaker: War
Text: Where can I find these Guardians?

Speaker: Samael
Text: First, seek the Twilight Cathedral, where the Bat Queen Tiamat has gone to roost. The whole of her domain is a blistered inferno. By land, you will never reach it. Find the high ground... with this. And bring me her still-beating Heart!
[War is on its way. In the cemetery, he meets Vulgrim.]

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: Samael has returned you in one piece. He must like you...
[War finds another “door” and blows the horn.]

Speaker: Gate
Text: Hmmmn....

Speaker: War
Text: I have come for the Destroyer.

Speaker: Gate
Text: My brothers spoke of your coming. But, a powerful curse holds me now. I cannot help you.

Speaker: War
Text: Any curse can be broken.

Speaker: Gate
Text: Yes... perhaps... These servants of the Destroyer walk unseen within the Realm of Shadow. By their blood we are bound... By their blood shall we be free.

Speaker: War
Text: I’m no longer move within the Shadow Realm. Much of my power has left me.

Speaker: Gate
Text: You need not enter it! I will grant you the power to see into the accursed realm for a time. But, to what end? What hope have we now against the Destroyer’s foul sorcery

Speaker: War
Text: Hope will not bring you freedom.

Speaker: Gate
Text: Yes...
[The door breathes on War, carrying it into the world of shadows.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Find where these Shadow Lurkers hide and KILL THEM ALL! They can’t be that hard to find. Surely this is no challenge for the likes of you? Excellent. I always knew you had it in you. Now THAT was entertaining. Can we do it again?
[War deals with the enemies holding the door.]

Speaker: Gate
Text: Ancestors praise you.
[The door goes away and War continues his journey. On the destroyed bridge, he notices the angels flying by and hides.]

Speaker: Angel
Text: This way!

Speaker: Angel 2
Text: It’s nothing. Some demon trick.

Speaker: Angel
Text: I know what I saw.

Speaker: Woman Angel
Text: He’s right.

Speaker: Angel
Text: Uriel.

Speaker: Uriel
Text: It’s there, beneath the stench of this place... You can sense it. Ancient. From neither the White City nor the Black Depths... something lost between.
[War attacks the angels by jumping on one of them flying a griffin.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Hellguard, TO ARMS!!! Slay him! Bring him to justice! Bring him down! The Horseman approaches.
[War manages to shake off the pursuers and lands at The Twilight Cathedral.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Tiamat I assume? Guess she wasn’t up for having visitors today.
[War begins to rise to the top of this enormous cathedral.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: What… is this place? I have to admit, for a bunch of weaklings, those humans were full of surprises. Who knows what secrets they buried down here?
[At the top, he finds a huge bat flying straight out of Hell.]

Speaker: Tiamat
Text: Has the Council reduced the Horsemen to common assassins? Or has Samael bought your loyalty? Because, if you are for sale, Rider... perhaps we can strike a deal.

Speaker: War
Text: You won’t like my terms.
[War beats a giant bat and rips off her wings.]

Speaker: Tiamat
Text: Horseman...

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Do it! Tear out her Heart while she still lives... I want to hear her scream!

Speaker: Tiamat
Text: ...I am... one of the Chosen... I can giant... your every wish...

Speaker: War
Text: Can you restore the Balance?
[Tiamat screams and War rips her heart out.]

Speaker: Wiatcher
Text: No wonder Samael wants this thing, it’s COURSING with power! You really think he’s going to let you live long enough to collect on your end?
[War is teleporting to the entrance to the cathedral. Vulgrim runs up to him.]

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: Tragic... Without your feathered friend, how will you escape this prison of rock?

Speaker: War
Text: I’ll find a way.

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: You have certainly proven yourself.... resourceful. Perhaps I can provide a quicker way.

Speaker: War
Text: Speak plainly, Demon...

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: Serpent Holes... Ancient paths that worm their way beneath the husk of this dead world... and beyond. I use them to get about, and for a price... so can you!

Speaker: War
Text: What do you want... Vulgrim?

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: A trifle really... the Chosen’s heart. I felt its power the moment you stepped from that tower.
[War is looking at a cocky demon with an evil eye.]

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: You wound me, Horseman... I would never come between you and your friend Samael. No, I only wish to look at the heart. One glance... and our bargain is sealed.
[War takes out the heart of Tiamat. Vulgrim greedily draws his hands to it, but War quickly takes it back.]

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: Samael will be pleased. The Serpent Holes are yours, Horseman. Seek me out when you wish to use them.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: You’ve brought down Tiamat, have you? The Destroyer will not be pleased. You need Vulgrim more than ever, yesss?
[War is returning to Samuel.]

Speaker: Samael
Text: I trust that she suffered?

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Not nearly enough.
[War takes out the heart.]

Speaker: Samael
Text: Beautiful... The second Guardian -- the Griever, moves in tunnels beneath this place. But first, there is an... obstacle that must be removed. Ulthane. One of the Old Ones.

Speaker: War
Text: You didn’t mention that before.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Changing the deal already, Samael?

Speaker: Samael
Text: Be silent, filth. My business is with the Horseman. Ulthane is no ally of the Destroyer... but you won’t find the Griever without confronting the Black Hammer. And that will require strength you don’t possess... huh... yet!

Speaker: Watcher
Text: URK! What the hell do you think you’re doing Samael?

Speaker: Samael
Text: Tell him Watcher. How you stifle the Horseman’s true power in order to keep him on the Council’s leash. War -- destroy this parasite.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: You so much as blink at me and the Council will end you. BOTH of you! I’m PROTECTED!

Speaker: Samael
Text: Not in here. You are War! Rider of the Red Horse! Not some puppet on this pathetic creature’s strings!

Speaker: Watcher
Text: War, I will make you suffer! Focus your anger. A great rage stirs within you, clawing to get out. You MUST release it. Or a puppet you’ll remain.
[War gathers all its anger and hatred and smashes The Watcher on the ground, leaving him alive.]

Speaker: Samael
Text: You are reborn!
[War gets his demonic form back.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: What... was that?!

Speaker: Samael
Text: The Horseman is broken, but there is still much power in him. For a moment I saw... one who would stand alone against the Destroyer’s ARMY.
[War goes to some flooded city and at its furthest end finds another door.]

Speaker: Gate
Text: Forgive me, friend. I would grant you passage were it within my power. Do for me what you have done for my brethren, and I will hinder you no more.

Speaker: War
Text: There must be another way.

Speaker: Gate
Text: The Curse must be broken. Then, you may pass.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Find where these Shadow Lurkers hide and KILL THEM ALL! They can’t be that hard to find. I always knew you had it in you. Now THAT was entertaining. Can we do it again? Looks like that was the last of them. Let’s get out of here.
[War kills the keepers of the curse in the world of shadows and goes back.]

Speaker: Gate
Text: Ancestors praise you. Soon... we will be free…

[War goes on and finds a huge hammer lying in the middle of a ruined building that has been overgrown with bushes. Naturally, it immediately occurs to him to take the hammer for himself - why lose a good tool.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Come on, already! What are you waiting for?!

Speaker: Giant Dwarf
Text: You plan on usin’ them hands ever again... You’d best not go touchin’... that what ain’t yers.
[He’s kicking the car he was sitting on off, launching it into the sky.]

Speaker: War
Text: Ulthane.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: You know me. But I don’t know you. And I don’t like strangers. Especially the uninvited kind. And maybe who you are don’t matter as much as what you want.

Speaker: War
Text: I’ve come for the Black Hammer.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Really now?! Well, you’re welcome to give it another go. But after that, I best not catch you around here again.

Speaker: War
Text: It’s you...

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: What’s that now?

Speaker: War
Text: The Black Hammer... It’s you.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Do yer worst. But let me tell you a little secret, boy. The one in the dirt, is by far... the easier of the two.
[They’re starting to fight.]

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Yer throwin glass against stone, boy. That blade’s big. But I’m bigger.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: That blade of yours is useless against him. Perhaps there is another way.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: WATCH OUT!!!

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Try getting all big red and nasty on him. Maybe that will work.
[War transforms into his demonic form.]

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Impressive! I ain’t been tagged in millennia... Hmm.
[He runs to War wanting to continue the fight, but here the angels come.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: One hundred years... Since the day Abaddon was taken from us, I have prayed for this moment. For your crimes, I would see you tried in the White City. But until this world is free of the Destroyer, its gates are closed to us. And justice will not wait. I sentence you, here and NOW!!
[They cross swords, but here one of the angels is nailed to the ground with a huge hammer.]

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Yer justice can wait till we finish our little scrap, missy. There ain’t no sport jumpin’ into a tussle what don’t concern you. Go’on! Fly away, pigeons! ’fore I pluck ya.

Speaker: Angel 2
Text: Blasphemer, it is you who takes sides... in a battle that doesn’t... concern you...

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Bwawwwwhawwhaww! Please... Allow me.
[He jumps off a building, grabs his hammer, and with one strike smash the angel to the fluff and feathers.]

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: That’s what ya get fer touchin’ what ain’t yerz. I’d duck if I was you.
[Massive battle begins. War is looking for the entrance to the subway and together with Ulthane they repel the attacks of numerous angels.]

Speaker: Angel
Text: We will not yield! Bring him to justice! Bring him down! For the Light!

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: My pillows need a little stuffin’!

Speaker: Angel
Text: Your justice is at hand.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Out of my way!

Speaker: Watcher
Text: I hope this Old One knows where he’s going. We came for the Griever’s Heart, remember?!

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Is that all you’ve got? Get over here, blast it!

Speaker: Angel
Text: The Horseman approaches. For the Hellguard!

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Shove off, pigeons. Okay, now you’re just showin’ off. Over here, stranger. What you waiting for, drop this thing. C’mon, give us a hand over here.
[They manage to fight off the angels, and the War has killed more angels than Ulthane.]

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Quick on the draw, are we? You won. Fair ’n square.
[The angel commander is waiting for him outside the door.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: You’ll go nowhere, Horseman. You cannot escape your fate. Abaddon will be avenged. Defend yourself traitor.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Gets me all worked up just thinking about killing her, but I’ll settle for watching you do it.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Impressive!
[War win the fight. Two angels carry away the beaten Uriel.]

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Ah, could be you really are who you say. Them pigeons seemed mighty convinced. But I ain’t. So once again. You know me, but I still don’t know you.

Speaker: War
Text: The Griever’s lair.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: The Griever’s beyond here. Had to seal these passages up tight to keep her pets outta my yard. Little bastards kept droppin’ by uninvited. Taking things what don’t belong to ’em.

Speaker: War
Text: I am who I claim to be.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: You kill that Griever. You even make it back out o’ that hole, that’ll be proof enough. Then, I promise, we’ll have words. Now get offa my property before more pigeons come lookin’ an crap in me yard.
[He opens the door to War, and he continues his journey to the second heart. Surprisingly, he meets his target in the foyer, but Griever’s manage to escape.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: I think all you managed to do was piss her off. Let’s find her and finish the job. And don’t toy around with her this time!

[War begins to survey the half-submerged subway tunnels, solving puzzles with trains and fighting countless monsters. Finally, he finds Griever in the depot. He takes a wagon and smashes the icy shell covering her heart.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Two down, two to go. You might make it to the Tower after all. Then, the real fun begins.
[The war will teleport back to Ulthane. He grabbed his hammer with his new reinforcing glove and throws it through his door. The hammer flies an inch from the head of the Ulthane himself. ]

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Ah. Welcome back, Horseman. You could have knocked. But I suppose that isn’t your way, is it?

Speaker: War
Text: Why are you here?

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Strange question, seein’ how you’re the one, broke into MY house!

Speaker: War
Text: You weren’t always the ’Black Hammer’. You huddle in exile -- a hermit among tombstones. Why? What role did you play in this, Ulthane?

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Horseman... I’ve got something for you. A fair bit o’ work, but... it’s a bit dainty for me. It’ll serve you better.
[He throws him a gun. War, without hesitation, aims the “gift” to its creator.]

Speaker: War
Text: You didn’t answer my question, ’Old One’.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Maybe I like the scenery. What’s it to you? You asked for my help, and I gave it. You go on bein’ ungrateful and I’m liable to get upset. Do I look like I’m afraid o’ death boy?
[The war takes the gun away and walks away.]

Speaker: War
Text: It’s not ‘death’ you should fear.
[He’s going back to Samael.]

Speaker: Samael
Text: Did you enjoy yourself? War and the Black Hammer ‘plucking pigeons’. (laughs]

Speaker: War
Text: You see a great many things from inside a prison, Samael.

Speaker: Samael
Text: There is little you can keep from me Horseman, once I have a mind to know it.

Speaker: War
Text: And what do you know of Uriel?

Speaker: Samael
Text: Oh, I thought the Horsemen were above such earthly pursuits.

Speaker: War
Text: She believes I killed Abaddon.

Speaker: Samael
Text: The Hellguard worshiped their fallen lord and leader. And Uriel... some might say her admiration was less than professional. She will stop at nothing to punish the one responsible.

Speaker: War
Text: I fought the demon who killed Abaddon. And he will be punished.

Speaker: Samael
Text: Straga is the strongest of the Chosen. No doubt you’ll face him again -- he draws power from the spire, and won’t stand to be away from it for long.

Speaker: Samael
Text: With all I have taught you, you might even survive the reunion.

Speaker: War
Text: Who’s Heart would you have, demon?

Speaker: Samael
Text: The Stygian is King of the ancient worms that now plague the Ashlands. It won’t be easy. The worms grow well in such fertile ground.

Speaker: War
Text: Fertile?

Speaker: Samael
Text: Fertile with death. Decay. All the land is covered in it. The ashes of the dead. But you may be in luck. It seems that some fool demons have taken to capturing the worms for sport. And they hunt... other creatures as well. The strongest are made to fight in cruel arenas. The demons seek to tame the Stygian. Not knowing that within the monster, there beats a black Heart of the Chosen.

Speaker: War
Text: How do the demons avoid the Ashworms?

Speaker: Samael
Text: You know of the Chronospheres?

Speaker: War
Text: A gift of The Old Ones. It is said that to master the Chronosphere is to master time itself. One could stop time, or even move it -- forward and back.

Speaker: Samael
Text: Indeed. None of the old masters exist, but the demons have learned to use them, to a lesser degree... I can grant you a basic understanding of the Chronosphemes. It won’t be much -- perhaps just enough to avoid the worms.

Speaker: War
Text: Perhaps?

Speaker: Samael
Text: Perhaps not. What in this life is certain, Horseman...? ...other than our word, of course?
[War goes to the desert to find the Stygian...]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Samael wasn’t kidding about those worms! And the Stygian’s supposed to be the ‘mean’ one...
[War is being attacked by entire hordes of various beings.]

Speaker: Dual Blade Demon
Text: Destroy him! My sisters warned me of you.

Speaker: Demon with Axe
Text: To my side, dogs! You’ll not take another step! He comes. We do not fear you. Die! Is that all? Bury him, Tear him apart! His death will bring us glory. He can’t kill us all. A feast for the worms! Hahaha. Fools, he is dangerous! Leave nothing of him!
[When War sliced up an entire pile of monsters his faces their captain - horned freak in the hood on a fiery horse.]

Speaker: Horned Freak
Text: You disappoint me, Horseman. You look quite small from up here.

Speaker: War
Text: You can look me in the eye when I kill you.

Speaker: Horned Freak
Text: Let’s see how you fare, Horseman, with only two legs to carry you.
[The fight begins.]

Speaker: Horned Freak
Text: I will savor this victory. You fight well! I’ll make this quick, but not painless. Look how he cowers!! His death will bring us glory.
[The war chops off his legs, looking him right in the eyes. But his horse is still alive.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: What do you think you’re doing? That thing’s lost its mind! KILL IT! Enough I said! Finish it.

Speaker: War
Text: Ruin... I won’t fight you.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: You FOOL! I order you to break that nag.

Speaker: War
Text: And if I refuse, you’ll kill me? I’ll take my chances.
[Ruin goes back to her master. The subordinates of the killed ringleader are going on the field.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Are you not entertained?!
[On Ruin’s back, War easily dealt with them.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: You’re little reunion brings a tear to my eye, now can we go?! That filthy beast might be your only hope of finding the Stygian.
[They encounter a giant sandworm.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Did you see that? There was something glowing in it’s mouth right before it turned you into kibble! Well done. But that was only practice for the Stygian. The biggest, and meanest of them all.
[Soon the War taste the fighting with the Sandworm King himself.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: So, that’s the Stygian. Looks like they worked him over pretty good. Now you just have to get in there and finish what they started. Ride Horseman! Do what you were BORN to do!
[Finally, Stygian is defeated.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: I guess there’s nothing left to do but get the Stygian’s Heart back to Samael. Still, all these hearts the power he’ll get from them... I hope you know what you’re doing.

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: Bravo Horseman... Even the ash crawling Stygian lies dead in your wake. Who can stand against you?
[War returns to Samael.]

Speaker: Samael
Text: One more... Just one more -- and then, War... you get your Tower. Silitha’s web-infested lair is far across a great chasm in the Ashlands. Ruin has yet to regain much of his strength, but he will make the distance. As for, Silitha -- just get there, and she’ll find you. The Broodmother is a collector of sorts. Most who enter her realm, she feeds to her young. The ones she takes an interest in... ah, those are the unlucky ones. Those she keeps alive. And they can live a long time... long enough to tell her things. You could say she collects stories. Information.

Speaker: War
Text: What stories will she tell me about you, Samael?

Speaker: Samael
Text: Careful!! Or your ending will be a tragic one! Sometimes, the hero dies in the end.  But Horseman... I like stories that have a happy ending. Now bring me the final Heart!

[War gets back on the road. As soon as he enters the desert, he’s attacked by some spiders. War turns out to be tied by a spider web in a huge building of a former factory, as it seems to be. War begins to break through the spider web and crowds of spiders to his target. At the very top of the building, he finds who he’s looking for.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Silitha’s lair must lie beyond that sticky barrier, let’s finish this!

Speaker: Silitha
Text: You honor me with your presence, Horseman. There are so many stories about you. You have killed three of the Chosen. Taken their Hearts. Disturbing.... Is that why you have come? To slay the final Tower Guardian? To take my Heart? Did Samael tell you how we came to bear his tainted blood? Why his accursed power beats within our breast? It is not the Tower that the Chosen protect, Horseman Our charge, is to prevent Samael’s return at any cost. You may kill me and return to Samael with my Heart. But in him, you will face a threat greater than all the Chosen combined.

Speaker: War
Text: I did not come for your counsel, spider. Or your stories.

Speaker: Silitha
Text: My children will dance to the music of your screams.
[Epic battle begins.]

Speaker: Silitha
Text: Don’t rush our embrace… Ah! Hold still, little one.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: You need to find a way to get close to her!

Speaker: Silitha
Text: Ah! You are a fool to trust Samael. You’ll never take my Heart!
[War kills the huge spider by dumping it on a sharp rock.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Samael will be waiting for the last Heart. You think he’s going to let you live long enough to collect on your end?
[War is returning to Samuel.]

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: Silitha, I liked. Such a pity. But perhaps--you have souls to ease my sorrow?

Speaker: Samael
Text: I was beginning to worry you might not live up to your end of the bargain. Give it to me.
[War is not in a hurry to approach him. He has the heart of Silitha in one hand. The other is clutching his sword.]

Speaker: War
Text: You lied to me about the Chosen... They never guarded the Tower.

Speaker: Samael
Text: What does it matter? Our deal wasn’t for ancient history. I promised you the Tower, and you shall have it.
[Samael eats the last heart and is freed from his shackles.]

Speaker: Samael
Text: Did it amuse you, to deny me what’s rightfully mine? With my powers restored, I am like unto a GOD! I could suck the marrow from your bones before you drew another breath. I could... but I too have a code by which I do business. Besides, say what you will about Balance and your ridiculous Law. I recognize a quest for revenge when I see one. And revenge, I respect! As for the details of my ’resignation’… well... I do not approve of the company my master keeps.
[He’s opening a portal for War.]

Speaker: War
Text: Why did you challenge the Destroyer, Samael?

Speaker: Samael
Text: See your journey to its end, Horseman, you will understand soon enough.

Speaker: War
Text: You --- trust him?! Who knows where in the Nine Hells this portal will take us?!

Speaker: Samael
Text: We will meet again.
[War teleports to the Black Throne where it meets an angel with big wings.]

Speaker: War
Text: Azrael...

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Heaven help me... Th-the Seventh Seal... was not broken...

Speaker: War
Text: What have you to fear from me, Angel of Death?

Speaker: Azrael
Text: If you do not intend to kill me, then perhaps... you will help me?

Speaker: War
Text: You’ve given me no reason to do either.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Listen to me. The Gate must be shut. The Tower must be cut off from the well! It is from the Well that the Destroyer draws his power.

Speaker: War
Text: The Well of Souls?

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Millions of souls... yes. Enslaved... twisted. A corrupt power to fuel the Destroyer’s armies!

Speaker: War
Text: You are Steward of the Underworld. Watcher of the Well. Not a single soul flows back into this world without you knowing... unless, gatekeeper, you opened the way?

Speaker: Azrael
Text: The Destroyer sent the mightiest of his Chosen against me. I fared no better than you did, Horseman... against Straga.

Speaker: War
Text: Straga! You will take me to him?

Speaker: Azrael
Text: You have my word.

Speaker: War
Text: Then tell me what I must do... Angel of Death.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Please, you must find some way to draw power to this chamber!

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Horseman... I never imagined that you would be my salvation. Hurry now, before Straga learns of your coming.

Speaker: War
Text: When I found you, you said, “The Seventh Seal was not broken”. I’ve heard those words before. Abaddon said the same... right before he died.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: The beams... redirect the beams...
[The war goes to solve many puzzles to redirect the rays for the Angel of Death. After he’s succeeded...]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: The universe... is sick, Horseman. The Charred Council refuses to admit it, but those of us who look... we see... we had to do something.
[Azrael recalls the event before the Apocalypse.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: An open attack on the Dark Kingdom would violate the treaty! What you’re proposing is madness!

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: Azrael, evil darkens every corner of creation... and Heaven waits?! The Council ties our hands!!

Speaker: Azrael
Text: To question them is to question the Creator... Do you believe you know better?

Speaker: Abadon
Text: Yes, old friend... I do. When the Seals are broken, Hell will send its Chosen to declare battle rights. Their leaders will be gathered in one place. And there... we will sever the head of the beast.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Breaking the Seals will trigger the Endwar! The Kingdom of Man is not yet strong enough. Earth will be destroyed!!

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: No, there will be no war, Azrael! We will crush the Dark Ones before it’s even begun.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: The pact is a sacred covenant. Even in victory we will face the wrath of the Council.

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: They will arrive to find the Seals intact. And it will be our word... Heaven’s word, against that of the Prince of Lies. Now do you see?

Speaker: Azrael
Text: The Seals will be reforged. All will believe that Hell’s legions invaded and were delivered to justice by our hand. For the Glory of the Light, will you do this?

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Oh Azrael... you old fool.
[He gives Azrael a skillfully decorated blade that radiates with magic. Azrael reads the spell, and stuck the sword into the seal. Back to the present.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: We broke all but one. Abaddon ordered the final Seal not be harmed. He protected it himself!

Speaker: War
Text: Are you certain?

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Without question. We... dared not involve the Horsemen. We never dreamed we would have to, until it was too late...

Speaker: War
Text: Yet I am to pay the price for your betrayal!

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Treason!!! War, you will root out all involved, and make them PAY! Starting with this one!

Speaker: War
Text: Νο.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Fool! You deny the will of the Council?

Speaker: War
Text: You heard the angel’s confession. My service to the Council is ended.
[The Watcher is stifling war with pain.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: We made you! We own you! You’re not done until you find the Destroyer and shut him down! “Balance"... remember? Get up. Azrael lives until he stops being useful. After that, you WILL do your duty.
[War continues to solve puzzles.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: One final beam, and I will be free.
[Finally, Azrael is released and opens the passage to the master of the tower.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Please... leave me... Straga awaits.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Looks like you’ve finally outlived your usefulness, Azrael.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: And how do you propose to leave the Tower once Straga has been dealt with? Straga and the Tower are one. Even if you manage to defeat him, you’ll be trapped without me,

Speaker: War
Text: We need him.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Pray the Horseman doesn’t make it back alive.
[War goes up and enters a vast hall, where the demon he encountered during the Apocalypse awaits him.]

Speaker: Straga
Text: Hmmm... You are stronger than Straga remembers. But here you face Straga with no hope of victory or escape. Straga is the mightiest of the Destroyer’s CHOSEN!

Speaker: War
Text: And the last. Your master chose poorly.
[He takes out his sword and the fight begins.]

Speaker: Straga
Text: Straga will enjoy killing you again! How long will you run from Straga? This time, you will STAY dead! Tricky Horseman… now it’s Straga’s turn!
[War penetrates into Straga and breaks out of his skull. Azrael appears.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: As I said, Straga and the Tower are one. Now, let’s see how useful I can be.
[He’s turning a dead body of the mater of the tower into a giant portal.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Into the well! HURRY!
[They move to some bright, calm and blooming place.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: He came to me after his death. Abaddon. Alive, and I wanted so much to believe... I was such a fool...

Speaker: War
Text: Azrael -- you saw Abaddon after he fell?

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Saw him? I brought him here -- to Eden.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: What treachery is this Azrael? Eden doesn’t exist. Not any more...

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Ignorant sprite! I bore witness as the First Ones were cast out and the Garden fell to ruin! I could not let Heaven’s first gift... and greatest weapon, simply rot, or worse, fall to darkness. I...hid it away.

Speaker: War
Text: The Tree of Knowledge. Then... Abaddon has been to the tree?!

Speaker: Azrael
Text: You must draw upon its gifts now. If some way exists to stop the Destroyer, the tree will show it to you. I never dared use it myself. Perhaps if I had, things would have been... different.

Speaker: War
Text: And Abaddon? What of his gift?

Speaker: Azrael
Text: That was not for me to know. Each who comes before the tree receives a different gift. Some receive nothing. Others are driven mad by visions, or simply destroyed. No, I cannot say for certain. Come.

Speaker: War
Text: There’s no way across.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: There is, for those who are worthy. Or those who can fly. Horseman, you have fought against the darkness so long that it has marked you. Creatures of the light will sense it, as I have. In this place you are worse than a demon. Conquer the shadow! Then, you may pass. Are you ready to face yourself in the light? Not all are prepared for what they see.

Speaker: War
Text: The Mask of Shadows.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Yes. You will see into the Shadow Realm for as long as you wear the Mask. Fight well.
[War has to fight its own shadow.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Heaven’s first gift awaits you. I will remain here, with the Watcher.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: I’m not letting the Horseman out of my sight! Where he goes, I go!

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Indeed? Go then darkling -- make for the Tree. You will never reach the other side.
[The Watcher is shackling War with pain again.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Hurry up! And don’t forget who holds the leash.
[The war goes upstairs and enters the courtyard. Everything around is shrouded in mist. He is overwhelmed by a vision of past events.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Would you serve in Heaven? Or rule in Hell?

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: A storm is coming, Uriel. Soon - I will need you at my side.

Speaker: Uriel
Text: I would follow you into Hell, my Lord.

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: They knew... how did they...?

Speaker: Uriel
Text: “The best laid plans...” or so the humans used to say.

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: You... did this...?

Speaker: Uriel
Text: You plotted and schemed to call us to this world. I simply took advantage of your initiative.

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: ΝΟ...

Speaker: Uriel
Text: I will consider this an offering Abaddon -- and you, my loyal servant. Join me, and take up the mantle of the Destroyer!

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: NO...

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Once the Throne learns what you’ve done, you will be cast down. Dragged in chains before the Council. You’re already damned. So, I offer you this choice... Would you serve in Heaven? Or rule in hell?
[Abaddon screams and turns into a giant fire-breathing dragon – The Destroyer.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Now, return to Azrael. Persuade him to help us. Then... together, we will change the face of the universe. (laughs]

Speaker: Judge 2
Text: Abaddon MUST be punished! He bends the Law to his will! Laughs in the face of the Council!

Speaker: Judge 1
Text: What proof do we have? The Seals are intact! No doubt the angel had help. But from whom? Until we know, we must WAIT!

Speaker: Judge 2
Text: His act breeds open defiance! The Council weakens... How long before we are overthrown?

Speaker: Judge 1
Text: We cannot stop Abaddon... but there are others who might -- if they had reason...

Speaker: Judge 3
Text: We dare not send the Four! Without proof, there is no justice. Only murder. They will see no reason in this... assassination!

Speaker: Judge 1
Text: We will send one, for whom vengeance is reason enough.

Speaker: Abaddon the Destroyer
Text: The blade is scattered. I guard the Seventh Seal! This world is ours! Heaven is ours!!

Speaker: Watcher
Text: You had to know it was a one way ticket...
[War is waking up. In his hands is the handle of the sword with which he was pierced in his memories - the sword with which the seal was broken.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Well?

Speaker: War
Text: Abaddon is the Destroyer.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: The Archangel?

Speaker: War
Text: He was betrayed. He is only a pawn in some greater game.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: You must... bring him peace...

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Peace? Abaddon is the Destroyer! I’m pretty sure peace is off the table.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Did you find any clues among the visions? A way to stop--him?

Speaker: War
Text: There was a sword--one which broke the seals.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: The Armageddon Blade. But... after the seals were broken, Abaddon ordered the blade destroyed, on the very anvil of its creation Horseman... I fear the blade is lost to us now.

Speaker: War
Text: It will be made again.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: What else did you see?

Speaker: War
Text: Abaddon guards the Seventh Seal. He plots with others to storm the White Gates. Uriel will lead the Hellguard against him... and fail.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: What else did you see?

Speaker: War
Text: I saw nothing else.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: I will open a gate to return us. Once it is closed, the Garden and its secrets will be lost forever.

Speaker: War
Text: The Shadow Realm.

Speaker: Azrael
Text: Yes. Use the Mask of Shadows. Assemble the broken blade. Then, return it to the forge of the Black Hammer. When this is done, return to me. Perhaps I can serve you one last time before the end.

Speaker: War
Text: Azrael... at any time you could have left me to my fate. Dead in the Tower. Lost among the ashes of Eden. Why do you help me now? When this is over the Council will see that justice is done. I will kill Abaddon. And all who schemed with him...

Speaker: Azrael
Text: We all must answer for our sins, Horseman. When the hour of my judgment comes, I will embrace it. Whatever the light decides… Go! Waste no more time on me, And tell Ulthane… he is the last hope of an old fool. The blade was scattered over this ruined world. Find the pieces - forge them at the hand of the Black Hammer then return.
[War is heading out.]

Speaker: Vulgrim
Text: So---the final battle is before you! You are wise to seek help from old Vulgrim!
[Uriel descends from the sky above as he approaches one of the pieces on the Crossroads.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: This is no ambush, Horseman. I come alone.
[She stuck her sword in the ground.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: I, Uriel of the Hellguard, Champion of the White City -- call you, Horseman, to Nex Sacramentum.

Speaker: War
Text: Fool...

Speaker: Uriel
Text: I lay claim to your life before the Creator... will you dishonor this law as well?
[War is sticking its sword next to hers.]

Speaker: War
Text: Why?

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Because Abaddon said you understood honor... and because... he was the best of us.

Speaker: War
Text: The Death Oath cannot be broken... Until one falls by the hand of the other... I accept.
[They fight.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: You cannot escape your fate. You underestimate me. Defend yourself traitor.
[Pretty soon, War prevails.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Yes. YESss! What are you waiting for? Harvest this wench!! War?! Don’t you dare walk away from me!

Speaker: War
Text: The Nex Sacramentum is MINE. I decide when the angel dies. Not YOU.

Speaker: Uriel
Text: You swore an oath to me...

Speaker: War
Text: Abaddon is The Destroyer.

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Liar!

Speaker: War
Text: To protect you, he kept you from the truth. You pledged to follow your Lord into Hell, never knowing what awaited you. Or what he would become.

Speaker: Uriel
Text: ...Abaddon...

Speaker: War
Text: He was betrayed, and became the enemy of all creation. I’ve been to the Tree. Its gift, was truth. And I share it with you now. Remember the Death Oath... Soon, it must be fulfilled.
[War takes the remaining pieces of the Armageddon sword and returns to Ulthane.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: That’s it... the last piece of that accursed blade. Now, get back to Ulthane and finish this business.

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: Good to see you again, Horseman.
[War puts pieces of the Armageddon sword before him.]

Speaker: Ulthane
Text: My greatest work...

Speaker: War
Text: Until now.

[Ulthane agrees and starts forging. The sounds of his hammer can be heard all over the earth. Azrael and Uriel ponder their own destiny to the sound of the hammer. When the sword is ready, Uriel, along with the other angels, attacks the Destroyer. ]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: This is for all cookies, Horseman. When you proceed, there’s no return.
[War returns to Azrael.]

Speaker: Azrael
Text: It’s Abaddon. Uriel has lead the Hellguard against him. It is as you foretold. The Hellguard will fall.

Speaker: War
Text: Angel of Death -- serve me one last time.
[The war flies away to help Uriel. When he lands, the angels parted before him, recognizing his power.]

Speaker: Abaddon The Destroyer
Text: She mistook me for... someone else. She loved him. And I believe that he loved her... long ago, before all this... Foolishly, he chose duty above all, and died for it. Will you do the same? Heaven hunts you... Hell hates you. All of creation cares not whether you live or die. Join me, War. Like a great sword, I will raise you up, and our enemies will shatter against us. The spoils of a thousand victories will be yours. Or, serve the justice of a corrupt Council. And a Creator who abandons his most faithful. I offer you this choice, Horseman. Would you serve in Heaven, or rule in Hell?

Speaker: War
Text: I choose what once, a coward did not.

[Abaddon lets Uriel out of his paws and roars furiously into war. The battle begins. Soon War succeeds in piercing the dragon with the sword of Armageddon and Abaddon returns to his human form. He falls on the platform, breaking through it.]

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: Ahhh... The Armageddon Blade. This will be interesting. You have forced my hand. Ah ah ah. I...will NOT fall to YOU! It ends NOW! You are no match for me. Ah ah ah.

Speaker: War
Text: You have taught me something, Abaddon. Sometimes duty must be cast aside, to do what must be done. It is not for duty that I kill you now.
[He rips off the blackened wings of Abaddon.]

Speaker: Abaddon
Text: Uriel... Uriel...

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Reap what you have sown, betrayer.
[The war pierces Abaddon with the sword. The seventh seal falls out of his soft hands… Watcher appears and stretches the leash.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: War!

Speaker: Watcher
Text: You had to know it was a one way ticket...

Speaker: War
Text: The… Council…

Speaker: Watcher
Text: They knew you’d never play executioner because of your precious honor. They let you take the fall... They knew you’d butcher everyone involved to clear your name. And you did.

Speaker: Uriel
Text: No!
[She’s trying to stop Watcher, but he easily throw her away.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Patience, whore. I’ve got some for you too.
[He’s take the seventh seal.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: I’ll take that... If it were to get broken, you might get ideas -- like not going back in your little cage. It’s tragic, really. You had freedom in the palm of your hand… and you LOST it!
[War laughs.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: What’s so damn funny? Even you wouldn’t laugh at your own funeral.

Speaker: War
Text: I’m laughing... at yours.
[Suddenly Uriel flies, pierces the war with his sword and breaks the seal in Watcher’s hands.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Nex Sacramentum. The Death Oath is complete.

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Hellguard bitch! What did you do?!
[He’s trying to put the seal together. War is slowly resurrecting.]
[Then he attacks Uriel and strikes her with a spell.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: I’m going to pull your guts out through your halo!
[War is stopping his hand.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: Keep getting up... I’ll just kill you again!
[War this his in the face.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: I was just following orders... like you...
[War hits him again.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: What are you going to do, fight the Council? Fight EVERYONE?!!
[War huts him the third time.]

Speaker: Watcher
Text: You’ll never get away... you hear me? NEVER! Don’t... forget... who holds... the leash...

Speaker: War
Text: I haven’t forgotten.
[He grabbed Watcher’s head and crushed it like a walnut.]

Speaker: Uriel
Text: You knew... You knew what would happen here. What I would do. That’s why you spared me.

Speaker: War
Text: No.

Speaker: Uriel
Text: Then why?

Speaker: War
Text: Because I would not have the last of Heaven’s honor die with its Champion.

Speaker: Uriel
Text: All debts are repaid. The duty I uphold -- it may call me to raise my sword against you. And if that day comes, I won’t hesitate. You will be hunted! The White City for certain... The Council... and... there will be others! You would wage this war alone?!

Speaker: War
Text: No. Not alone.
[Three comets descend from the skies - purple (Death), red (Fury) and green (Strife).]
